checks.notes: Python

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
Infinigen is a Blender-based procedural generator that creates photorealistic 3D scenes/assets entirely from randomized mathematical rules (shape + materials) to produce unlimited synthetic worlds and renders. Infinigen directly supports
the goal of expanding limited datasets for underrepresented classes, particularly corals, by procedurally generating additional 3D volumes.

This was identified as model in “additional information” but review deems is as a software because it is not an AI model in traditional term.

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes:
The DynamicStereo codebase is primarily licensed under a non-commercial Creative Commons (CC-BY-NC) license for dataset usage, meaning it’s intended for research, educational, or artistic purposes only.

Use, modification, and publication are allowed for research or educational use.

Usage must comply with the Dynamic Replica License Agreement terms, especially regarding non-commercial research; commercial use is restricted to research purposes under the agreement.

Portions of the project code (e.g., third-party components like RAFT-Stereo) are under MIT or Apache 2.0 licenses, but the dataset access terms are separate.

The dataset download requires accepting a license agreement restricting use to permitted research contexts.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
TRELLIS is a large 3D asset generation model built around a unified Structured LATent
(SLAT) representation and Rectified Flow Transformers. It
uses a two-stage pipeline: first generate the sparse SLAT
structure, then generate latent vectors for non-empty
cells, enabling decoding into multiple 3D formats (radiance
fields / 3D Gaussians / meshes
TRELLIS is directly relevant as a strong
3D generative prior / baseline to build upon, adapt, and
extend toward your proposed 4D foundations (e.g., as an
initial generative component before/while developing
your own 4D model, and as a comparison point for
structured-latent approaches

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)

checks.notes:
https://github.com/microsoft/TRELLIS
Hugging Face: microsoft/TRELLIS-image-large -> 2,398,114  Downloads last month

Microsoft Research Asia (Spatial Intelligence Group) - owns and maintains the repository

Jianfeng Xiang - Lead author, PhD student at Tsinghua University, Research Intern at MSRA

Jiaolong Yang - Principal Research Manager, Microsoft Research Asia (jiaoyan@microsoft.com)

Xin Tong - Microsoft Research Asia


All authors of the paper for which the model is the artifact are affiliated with Microsoft, which is an entity from non-D5 country.

checks.name: Training Data Documentation
checks.notes:
TRELLIS-500K dataset - 500,000 3D assets curated from five sources:

Objaverse(XL) - largest component
ABO (Amazon Berkeley Objects)
3D-FUTURE (Alibaba furniture dataset)
HSSD (Habitat Synthetic Scenes Dataset)
Toys4k

Pretraining data: a carefully collected dataset of ~500K
diverse 3D assets (paper states 500K objects; the repo
also describes the 500K scale).
Tokens: TRELLIS is primarily trained on 3D assets (and
rendered views); it is not a text-token pretraining setup in
the usual LLM sense. The public materials emphasize
#assets (500K) rather than a “token count.”

checks.name: Customisation / Fine-tuning
checks.notes:
No separate “downstream fine-tuning task” is called out
for the released HF artifact; the released weights
correspond to the TRELLIS generative model trained for its
primary objective (text/image-conditioned 3D generation)

checks.notes:
TRELLIS-image-large: 1.2 billion parameters
MFU not provided.
Missing information to be able to calculate FLOPS

checks.notes: skipping inspection because of low risk.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
A two-stage system
comprising Hunyuan3D-DiT (a scalable flow-
based Diffusion Transformer for shape
generation) and Hunyuan3D-Paint (a texture
synthesis model). It uses a decoupled
pipeline where geometry is generated first,
followed by high-resolution texture map
synthesis
Provides a state-of-the-art
benchmark for multi-view consistency and
high-fidelity texture mapping. In the context
of coral modeling, its decoupled texture
synthesis (Hunyuan3D-Paint) is particularly
relevant for reconstructing complex surface
patterns and biological details from 2D
imagery

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes:
License name: “Tencent Hunyuan 3D 2.0 Community License Agreement” (release date stated as Jan 21, 2025).

Territory restriction: license is worldwide excluding EU, UK, and South Korea (use outside the Territory is unlicensed).

Rights granted: non-exclusive, non-transferable, royalty-free license to use/modify/distribute in-Territory, subject to Acceptable Use Policy.

Redistribution conditions: must provide a copy of the agreement to recipients; modified files must carry prominent change notices; distributions must include a specified “Notice” file text.

Commercial threshold: if your products/services exceed 1M monthly active users, you must request a separate license/approval from Tencent.

Model-improvement restriction: must not use the works/outputs to improve other AI models (except Hunyuan3D or its derivatives)

checks.name: Training Data Documentation
checks.notes:
The public materials describe training on a “self-collected large-scale 3D dataset” with rendered multi-view images (and discuss large 3D datasets such as Objaverse/Objaverse-XL as examples), but they do not provide a single consolidated sample/token count in the visible sections.

Trained on a massive scale of high-quality 3D
assets (proprietary and public). While
specific object counts for v2.0 are not
explicitly capped in public papers, it scales
significantly beyond the 1M+ assets used in
similar Tencent models

checks.notes: No fine-tuning on any downstream tasks

# of trainable parameters: ~4.3B total 

Primarily 3D assets and rendered mulƟ-view
images. Numerical "token" counts are not
the standard metric for this DiT; the scale is
measured in number of high-res 3D assets.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: An evolution of the original TRELLIS, moving from SLAT to the O-Voxel (Omni-Voxel) representation. It features a Sparse Compressed 3D VAE (SC-VAE) providing 16x spatial downsampling and Rectified Flow Transformers. It introduces a native 3D material generation stage for full PBR (Base Color, Metallic, Roughness) support.

checks.notes:
the HF URL provided is non-existent - assuming the source: https://huggingface.co/microsoft/TRELLIS.2-4B 

The project is from Microsoft (Microsoft Research / Microsoft AI) with co-authors including researchers affiliated with Tsinghua University and USTC, and the public release is under the Microsoft “microsoft/TRELLIS.2-4B” org on Hugging Face.
Affiliations based in China: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jiaolong-yang/ -> D5-Country

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes: MIT License (permissive; allows use, modification, distribution, and commercial use subject to MIT terms).

checks.name: Training Data Documentation
checks.notes: TRELLIS.2’s components are trained on public 3D asset datasets: SC-VAE training follows a “Trellis-500K” setup curated from Objaverse-XL, ABO, and HSSD (after filtering assets), while the generative model is trained on an extended ~800K-asset collection augmented with TexVerse, using rendered multi-view images (16 views per asset) as prompts.

checks.name: Customisation / Fine-tuning
checks.notes: The released checkpoint is described as a pre-trained foundation model (explicitly “base model w/o alignment”) and the public materials do not describe downstream fine-tuning targets beyond its core image-to-3D generation pipeline stages (structure/geometry/material generation).

checks.name: FLOPS Calculation
checks.notes:
# of trainable parameters:  ~4B parameters 
Structurally Dependent. TRELLIS.2 encodes a $1024^3$ resolution asset into approximately 9.6K latent tokens on average, but the actual sequence length is proportional to the surface area and structural complexity of the model

FLOPs/asset≈6×(4×109)×9600
FLOPs/epoch≈2.304×10^14×5×10^5=1.152×10^20

checks.notes: Skipped

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
SPAR3D (Stable Point-Aware 3D) reconstructs a UV-unwrapped, textured 3D mesh (with material parameters) from a single 512×512 image using a two-stage pipeline (point-cloud diffusion + regressive meshing) in under ~1 second.
The proposal positions models like SPAR3D as high-quality 3D priors that can be integrated with our generative– reconstruction pipeline, while also noting the need to adapt such models beyond synthetic/dense seƫngs to sparse, noisy, and incomplete real observations and to multi-view regimes.
